doc:
Harry Clark (actor) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_Clark_(actor) 0 Harry Clark (April 17, 1913 - February 28, 1956) was an American actor.Prior to his acting career, Clark was a physical education teacher, athlete, and factory worker who became involved with the International Ladies Garment Workers Union-sponsored revue Pins and Needles in 1937, and its success encouraged him to pursue a career in acting. His Broadway credits include The Skin of Our Teeth, One Touch of Venus, Call Me Mister, Kiss Me, Kate, Wish You Were Here, and Will Success Spoil Rock Hunter? From the early 1940s through the mid-1950s, Clark appeared in a string of B-movies. On television, he appeared on The United States Steel Hour's production of No Time for Sergeants and The Phil Silvers Show. He died unexpectedly, while playing handball at the Young Men's Christian Association on West 63rd Street, near his home in Manhattan. Harry Clark ( April_17_,_1913 - February_28_,_1956 ) was an_American_actor.Prior to his_acting_career , Clark was a_physical_education_teacher , athlete , and factory_worker who became involved with the_International_Ladies_Garment_Workers_Union-sponsored_revue_Pins and Needles in 1937 , and its_success encouraged him to_pursue a_career in acting . His_Broadway_credits include The_Skin of Our_Teeth , One_Touch of Venus , Call_Me_Mister , Kiss Me , Kate , Wish You Were Here , and Will_Success_Spoil_Rock_Hunter ? From the_early_1940s through the_mid-1950s , Clark appeared in a_string of B-movies . On television , he appeared on The_United_States_Steel_Hour 's_production of No_Time for Sergeants and The_Phil_Silvers_Show . He died unexpectedly , while playing handball at the_Young_Men 's_Christian_Association on West_63rd_Street , near his_home in Manhattan .
